mods.note: & V ( 4 - gerviceB of Sub-Assistant Surgeon Yemenmardi . We do not appear to have any previous information in regard to this matter; in any case the secondment of a subordinate medical officer for service as the Sultan’s private and personal medical attendant is not a question in v/hich this Office is particularly interested. ■' (5)/FILE COPY! ^ '*N M y\ Extract from Note of a (li^igsiori held on 17.11 •37. ■between Sir Aubrey Me t cglf~e, Oeurre tary, External Affairs Department, and His Highness the Sultan of Muscat, at which the Political Agent, Muscat, was also present. (4) Services of Sub-Assistant Surgeon Yemkenmardi . The Sultan asked what the position was as regards his request for the services of this medical officer. He stated he wished for this particular individual to he seconded for service as his private and personal medical attendant, and that he would have nothing to do with affairs of the State. The Sultan said that the final reply he had received from Sir Trenchard Powle was to the effect that he (Sir T. Powle) did not consider Dr. Yemkenmardi suitable for any further employment in the State. Secretary pointed out that as Dr. Yemkenmardi was employed by the Bombay Government he was not in a position to say whether his services could be made available or not, but that he would enquire into the matter

location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Coll 20/23 'Muscat: Question of employment of Sub Assistant Surgeon Yemenmardi (also, and more accurately, spelled as Yemkenmardi) as personal medical attendant to Sultan'

physicalDescription.extent: The file is arranged in chronological order from the back to the front.

Foliation: The main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 5; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is present in parallel between ff 2-4; these numbers are also written in pencil and are circled.A previous foliation sequence, which is also circled, has been superseded and therefore crossed out.

mods.abstract: The file contains two documents:an extract from notes on a discussion between Sir Aubrey Metcalfe, Secretary, External Affairs Department, Government of India, and the Sultan of Muscat (Sa‘īd ibn Taymūr Āl Bū Sa‘īd), on 17 November 1937, concerning the Sultan's wish to appoint Sub-Assistant Surgeon Yemkenmardi as his personal medical attendantA note stating that the India Office has no interest in the matter

name.namePart: Indian Political Service, External Affairs Department
